Here are some research papers on exercise monitoring systems using computer vision:

1. "Real-time Exercise Monitoring System using Computer Vision" by K. Muruganandam et al. In this paper, the authors proposed a system for real-time exercise monitoring using computer vision. The system tracks the movements of the user using a camera and provides real-time feedback on their form and posture.
2. "A Computer Vision Based Exercise Monitoring System" by Y. Guan et al. This paper presents a computer vision-based exercise monitoring system that can recognize and classify various exercises performed by a user. The system uses a camera to capture the user's movements and applies machine learning algorithms to classify the exercises.
3. "Vision-based Exercise Monitoring and Evaluation System for Physical Rehabilitation" by M. S. Sankar et al. In this paper, the authors proposed a vision-based exercise monitoring and evaluation system for physical rehabilitation. The system uses a camera to capture the user's movements and provides real-time feedback on their performance.
4. "Exercise Monitoring System using Computer Vision and Machine Learning" by S. C. Lee et al. This paper presents an exercise monitoring system that combines computer vision and machine learning techniques. The system uses a camera to capture the user's movements and applies machine learning algorithms to classify and evaluate the exercises.
5. "Real-time Exercise Monitoring System using Depth Sensor" by J. J. Lee et al. In this paper, the authors proposed a real-time exercise monitoring system using a depth sensor. The system tracks the user's movements in 3D space and provides real-time feedback on their form and posture.

These are just a few examples of research papers on exercise monitoring systems using computer vision. There are many more papers on this topic that you can explore depending on your interests and specific research goals.
